polish.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to make something smooth, bright, and shiny by rubbing it
polish.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: I spent all afternoon polishing the silver.
Polish the lenses with a piece of tissue.
polish.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to improve a piece of writing, a speech etc by making slight changes to it before it is completely finished
polish.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Your essay is good, you just need to polish it a bit.
polish.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a liquid, powder, or other substance that you rub into a surface to make it smooth and shiny
polish.translation[1].definitions[1].def: an act of polishing a surface to make it smooth and shiny
polish.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: An occasional polish will keep wall tiles looking good.
polish.translation[1].definitions[2].def: a high level of skill or style in the way someone performs, writes, or behaves
polish.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: Carlaâ€™s writing has potential, but it lacks polish.
polish.translation[1].definitions[3].def: the smooth shiny appearance of something produced by polishing
polish.translation[2].definitions[0].def: relating to Poland, its people, or its language
